biography: Friedhelm Christoph Hummel is a German neuroscientist and neurologist. A full professor at École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne, he is the Defitech Chair of Clinical Neuroengineering, and the head of the Hummel Laboratory at EPFL's School of Life Sciences. He also is an associate professor of clinical neuroscience at the University of Geneva.

He would be skilled in diagnosing the underlying causes of headaches and developing individualized treatment plans that may include lifestyle modifications, medications, and other therapeutic interventions.
*   **Epilepsy and Seizure Disorders:** Dr. Hummel likely has significant experience in diagnosing and managing epilepsy and other seizure disorders. He would be proficient in interpreting EEG studies, identifying seizure types, and prescribing appropriate anti-epileptic medications. He likely also provides guidance on lifestyle modifications and safety precautions to minimize the risk of seizures.
*   **Stroke and Cerebrovascular Diseases:** He likely possesses a thorough understanding of the pathophysiology of stroke and other cerebrovascular diseases. He would be skilled in recognizing the signs and symptoms of stroke, ordering appropriate diagnostic tests (such as CT scans and MRIs), and coordinating acute stroke treatment. He likely also provides long-term management and rehabilitation for stroke survivors.

Dr. Hummel would likely utilize clinical examination, neuroimaging, and pharmacological interventions to alleviate symptoms and improve quality of life.
*   **Neurodegenerative Diseases:** Dr. Hummel likely possesses a strong understanding of neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). He would be skilled in diagnosing these conditions, providing supportive care, and managing symptoms. He likely also provides guidance to patients and their families on disease progression and long-term care planning.
*   **Neuropathy and Nerve Disorders:** Dr. Hummel likely diagnoses and treats various types of neuropathy, including diabetic neuropathy, peripheral neuropathy, and carpal tunnel syndrome. He would be skilled in performing nerve conduction studies and electromyography (EMG) to assess nerve function. He likely also provides treatment options such as medications, physical therapy, and nerve blocks.

In addition to these common neurological conditions, Dr. Hummel likely possesses expertise in diagnosing and managing other neurological disorders, such as multiple sclerosis, spinal cord disorders, and neuromuscular diseases.
